title: Creamy Poblano Chicken
ingredients: 2 poblano chile peppers, cooked, peeled, seeded, and diced
8 skinned and boned chicken breast halves, cut into bite-size pieces
1 (10¾ -ounce) can cream of chicken and mushroom soup, undiluted
8-ounces of your favorite shredded cheese (Monterey Jack, Cheddar, etc.)
¼  cups butter or margarine, melted
instructions: Melt the butter and add the onion, chile pepper, and garlic and sauté for 5 minutes.  After the onion is translucent add the chicken pieces, salt, and pepper and cook, stirring often for 8 to 10 minutes or until chicken is done.  (Your selection of cooking pan will make a difference in the cooking time.)   Once the chicken is cooked (no pink in the flesh) stir in the soup and sour cream until the mixture is smooth.  Add the cheese and continue cooking for 7 to 8 minutes more or until the cheese is melted and well incorporated.
Source:  New Ways with Cornbread by Andria S. Hurst, Southern Living, February 1998.

Stir together the first five ingredients (the cornmeal, flour, baking powder, sugar and salt) in a large bowl.  Stir together the next three ingredients (egg, milk and melted butter) and then add the mixture to the cornmeal mixture.  Stir just until the dry ingredients are moistened.
Cook in a preheated, oiled waffle iron until just crisp.
source: New Ways with Cornbread by Andria S. Hurst, Southern Living, February 1998.
